The location is great! We were never more than 15 minutes from all the restaurants and shops we wanted to go to. Loved that downtown and C Street were 5 minutes away.
Libby is an excellent hostess with attention to detail and lovely decor/style throughout the home. We had everything we needed for our weekend getaway. A few spots were a little dusty (under bed & coffee maker) and could use a wipe down, but overall the home was clean.
Loved the thoughtful touches for our dog! She loved the pet bed and toys. She also loved the big fenced in backyard.
We enjoyed our stay and would absolutely book again!

review_text:
This house is spotless! Check in with keyless entry was a breeze. It was a bonus to be able to park in the garage. House was filled with details, like a Keurig and cups, plenty of dinnerware and silverware, and extra linens. This was a multi-generation girls trip and we had plenty of room with my mom, sister, niece, and me.
The house is located in a neighborhood with a feeling of being rural, yet having access to stores and restaurants within 5 minutes.
Noise level at night inside the house was low. The house backs up to a main road and is at the entrance of the subdivision. We could hear a train horn in the distance throughout the evening, and some airplanes overhead, with the airport about 10 miles away. We did not sit outside or use the yard.
The master bedroom was extremely bright early in the morning. There are blinds, but not curtains. If you like to sleep in past daybreak, you will need a sleep mask.
Communication with the hosts was very prompt and courteous. I would recommend this place!

review_text:
Wonderful place that's better than the photos!
The main common area was the big draw for us and it was wonderful. We visited family, had 4 generations from 96 yo to 18 months and everyone thoroughly enjoyed themselves.
With the fireplace in the center of the common area, you have a large open space but just enough of a divider that activities can be in the kitchen and living room areas. It's spacious, well-stocked and the fireplace isn't just for looks - it really heated the place! And it like the rest of Anastasiya's home, it's beautiful.
Wish we'd had more time, we could have had a movie night or even two... esp w massively large TV in main bedroom! Everyone loved the "Best Seat in the House" and the ample closet space was a plus. We were in love w the screened-in porch even though it was a bit cool to be out there.
It's a comfortable, beautiful, spacious home. If you want to have time together, this is the place!
Host Anastasiya was helpful and proactive - Thank you!

We loved the option of being able to use the kitchen and laundry room, it was especially helpful with all the kids clothing we had to clean. A beautiful and very thought out floor plan with many items at your disposal. We loved the shampoo, condition, and body soap in the restrooms. One of the best seats in the house was the master bathroom toilet. I definitely want to purchase one of those for our home. The heated seats were magnificent! The best amenity in the home was hands down the espresso machine. I have a similar model at home so I was able to use it with no problem at all. We enjoyed all the extras to make our fancy coffee drinks as well. The caramel drizzle was fantastic! The neighborhood was quiet and friendly. Overall, the stay was nothing short of fantastic. We appreciate greatly the last minute reservation and the clear communication throughout the whole process. We will gladly be returning if we ever come back to Springfield. Rating, 5 stars
,

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Kathleen was an absolutely lovely host! Staying with her was like dropping by an Aunt's house for the weekend whilst in town for other things. She made me feel so welcome, and she was readily available for any conversation or questions. But she also made me feel very free to come and go as needed, at any hour of the day, with no need to "check-in" or let them know my schedule throughout the day. I had my own code for the front door which worked perfectly, my own bathroom to use, and the bedroom/bathroom were at the front of the house so I didn't need to worry about walking through the rest of the property and disturbing anyone (nor did anyone disturb the area where I was staying.)
Our son just finished his Freshman year at Missouri State in Springfield, and we'll be making a lot of visits to the city. I hope that we will be able to stay with Kathleen and Bob for many of those visits to come!

Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2019
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Fun place to stay in a historic building. Everything has been redone and is one of the most unique place I've stayed in an Airbnb. Was not an issue for me but the master is quite bright in the morning but luckily the couple in there always bring eye masks when traveling so it wasn't a big deal - plus the room is lovely. We were a bit worried because the train track was so close but this wasn't an issue at all. Rooms are a bit lacking in privacy, but again it's an older building so that's part of its uniqueness. Fun bars within walking distance and we had a late breakfast and coffee at Big Momma's next door a couple of times - really good and fantastic service. Other restaurants are down the street but we didn't have time to try them out. If you enjoy eclectic places then you need to stay here when visiting Springfield.

If you are looking for an upscale retreat that is far better than any hotel in the area, this is it! A few of our local family members were so impressed with the place that they took pictures while dropping off groceries. Overall, we loved this place!

name: Paula
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2019
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We grew up in Springfield, and return to visit family every year. Commercial Street is a new and fun way for us to experience our home town. This loft is the perfect place to host groups! Its very spacious, very comfortable, appointed nicely and also allows some private spaces within it. Not to mention the beds and pillows are really really comfy! Great place to have friends and family congregate. You and your family will enjoy the swings as much as we did! The location can't be beat. C street is the happening place to be in Springfield as there are wonderful restaurants and fun shops right out the front door! It is a short drive to a multitude of things to do, as well as a quick drive from the Airport. Another unexpected bonus, the trains directly out back. Very interesting to watch this activity as well and they also lulled us to sleep every night. We will stay here again!

review_text:
Great little find on our road trip.
The house has real character.
It is small but as advertised but for one night and for a driving Pit Stop it was perfect.
The bed was comfy and sheets and towels soft, although we only had one set of towels.
Plenty of coffee, creamer etc as well as bathroom products.
Parking was directly outside the house and very safe.
The Neighbourhood was very quiet and we slept well.
its about a 10-15 mins to some great restaurants and bars.
We ate in Black Sheep and was fabulous if you like burgers and shakes!
(Hands down best I've ever had)
While it's unlikely we'll return as were from England and this road trip is a one off, if I was in the area I'd stay here again and recommend staying here also.

I loved the place and found it to be very cozy. I had my dog with me and the yard was tiny so it would be a little more crowded with a big puppy. I would still recommend for anyone visiting as a couple or just 2 occupants, any more would be very crowded. Great access to other areas of Springfield and worth the money I spent.

Kelleyâ€™s Place has a lot going for it. First of all, the neighborhood is just beautiful. I took a long walk down two of the country roads and you wouldnâ€™t think youâ€™re near a city. This home and the other homes in the area are unique, upscale and located on lovely lots. Neighborhood is peaceful and very quiet. I didnâ€™t use the deck but it would be a nice place to sit and read a book or enjoy a cup of coffee.
The private entry/access was nice, the bed was comfy and the shower was great with plenty of hot water. The wall-mounted HVAC unit was ultra quiet (silent really) and provided a nice, even heat. Itâ€™s really a perfect apartment for one or two people.
This is a pet friendly unit and I should have paid more attention to that when I booked. As such, I noticed a mild, doggie aroma as well as dog hairs on my socks when I walked around without shoes.
